content.description:
Easy route to setup for top rope.  Per the local guide - thin crack on the far left.  Good pro. A little tricky to place.

Left - keep left of the thin crack proing the crack

Right - take the steep face right of the crack proing in the horizontal slots

The local climbers guide says this is 5.9 and perhaps on trad it rates that way,but on top rope it feels more like a 5.7.
content.location: Route is far left of the Garden Wall - just left of Tossed Salad.  Easy to climb over the top and walk around or lower off or rappel down.

content.description: An easy first lead, jugs and rails everywhere.
content.protection: 4 bolts, anchors at the top. It's quicker to top out and walk off than to clean the route when you are done with it.
content.location: Last route to the left on the Garden Wall.

content.description: Two distinct cruxes characterize this climb. The bottom crux moving through the first roof is the easier of the 2. Steep blocks near the top round out the climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts/chain anchor - a little runout if you aren't comfortable at the grade. Small stoppers may help ease your mind a little.
content.location: Just to the right of Peabody.

content.description: Tricky moves down low lead to fun climbing higher up and through a large ledge. Traverse left at the top of the climb to gain the chain anchors.
The 2 distinct cruxes on this route are great. The lower move through the first roof is classic. A pumpy little move through the upper roof founds out the troubles.
I thought these 4 trad routes were great and there's never a line. Just left of Sherman, climb into the left facing corner and step right onto the face.
content.protection: Top rope or.. A small rack to 2". You only need ~4 pieces at the most for these short routes. Slings to extend pieces you place under the roof. Mostly horizontal cracks.
content.location: Between the bolted lines of Tossed Salad and Sherman. First anchor to the left of Sherman.

content.description: I thought these 4 trad routes were great and there's never a line. Right of Tossed Salad, split the face between the right and left facing corners and pull directly through the roof.  This is by far the hardest of the 4 trad routes.  The holds above the roof are not as good as you hope.
content.protection: Top rope or... A small rack to 2". You only need ~4 pieces at the most for these short routes. Slings to extend pieces you place under the roof.  Mostly horizontal cracks.
content.location: Chain anchors (unlike the other three). Between the bolted lines of Tossed Salad and Sherman. Third anchor to the right of Tossed Salad.

content.description: I thought these 4 trad routes were great and there's never a line. Right Tossed Salad, climb into the 2nd short corner and pull the intimidating but easy roof onto the face.
content.protection: Top rope or... A small rack to 2". You only need ~4 pieces at the most for these short routes. Slings to extend pieces you place under the roof.
content.location: Between the bolted lines of Tossed Salad and Sherman. Second anchor to the right of Tossed Salad.

content.description: I thought these 4 trad routes were great and there's never a line. Just right of Tossed Salad, climb into the short corner and pull the intimidating but easy roof onto the face.
content.protection: Top rope or... A small rack to 2".  You only need ~4 pieces at the most for these short routes.  Slings to extend pieces you place under the roof.
content.location: Between the bolted lines of Tossed Salad and Sherman.  First anchor to the right of Tossed Salad.

climbs.name: The Last of the Summer Wine

content.description: Nice dry line, gets some winter sun. A great route for a new leader or first time climber.
content.protection: 5 Bolts. Chain on top (shared with Jagged Edge)
content.location: Just right of The Jagged Edge

content.description: A superb line: tricky, technical and tenuous. Well equipped
content.location: Far right of Garden wall, the route follows the obvious arete.

climbs.name: Eat Your Roofage AKA Sandra Bullock

content.description: This is a fun route with two roofs. All the hard moves are well protected. The crux is at the the first roof, and the left variation is easier. If you go straight over the roof it probably is 10c, otherwise about 10a, in my opinion. The smaller roof before the chains is a bit cruxy, but easier. This is one of the best routes on the wall.
content.location: Look in the middle of the wall, behind the tree, at the obvious roof.

climbs.name: Between Good and Evil
climbs.fa: Bob Loomis, June 13, 2015, Seconded by Jess Roskelley

content.description: From guidebook. Difficult bulge at start (stick clip) with small steep jugs above.  It helps to take a small selection of smaller cams and nuts for the upper section.  Originally it was rated 5.9.
content.location: Just right of Eat Your Roofage.
